sen.j: 光孝天皇(こうこうてんのう、天長7年（830年） - 仁和3年8月26日（887年9月17日） 在位：元慶8年2月23日（884年3月23日） - 仁和3年8月26日（887年9月17日））は、第58代の天皇。
sen.e: Emperor KOKO (830 - September 17th, 887), his reign was March 23rd, 884 - September 17th 887, he was the 58th Emperor.
Emperor Koko (830 - September 17h, 887) was the fifty-eighth Emperor (his reign was from March 23, 884 to September 17, 887).
Emperor Koko (830 - September 17, 887) was the fifty-eighth Emperor (his reign was from March 23, 884 to September 17, 887).

sen.j: 諱は時康（ときやす）。
sen.e: His first name was Tokiyasu.
His first name was Tokiyasu.
His first name was Tokiyasu.

sen.j: 仁和帝（にんなのみかど）、小松帝（こまつのみかど）とも。
sen.e: He was also called Nina no Mikado or Komatsu no Mikado.
He was also called Nina no Mikado or Komatsu no Mikado.
He was also called Nina no Mikado or Komatsu no Mikado.

sen.j: 藤原氏は、この帝の治世で初めて関白を出した。
sen.e: FUJIWARA clan came up with a chancellor during his reign for the first time.
The FUJIWARA clan produced a chancellor for the first time during his reign.
The FUJIWARA clan produced a chancellor for the first time during his reign.

sen.j: 仁明天皇の第三皇子。
sen.e: He was the third Prince of Emperor NINMYO.
He was the third Prince of Emperor NINMYO.
He was the third prince of Emperor Nimmyo.

sen.j: 母は贈太政大臣藤原総継（ふさつぐ）の娘、澤子。
sen.e: Mother was the Grand Minister (titled after his death) FUJIWARA no Fusatsugu's daughter, Takushi.
His mother was Takushi, the daughter of Grand Minister (posthumous title) FUJIWARA no Fusatsugu.
His mother was Takushi, the daughter of Grand Minister (posthumous title) FUJIWARA no Fusatsugu.

sen.j: 兄弟には、文徳天皇、宗康親王、人康親王、本康親王、源多、源光がいる。
sen.e: His brothers were the Emperor Montoku Prince Saneyasu, Prince Motoyasu, MINAMOTO no Masaru and MINAMOTO no Hikaru.
His brothers were the Emperor Montoku, Prince Saneyasu, Prince Motoyasu, MINAMOTO no Masaru and MINAMOTO no Hikaru.
His brothers were the Emperor Montoku, Prince Muneyasu, Prince Saneyasu, Prince Motoyasu, MINAMOTO no Masaru and MINAMOTO no Hikaru.

sen.j: また嵯峨源氏の源是茂を養子としている。
sen.e: He also adopted MINAMOTO no Koreshige of Saga Genji. (the MINAMOTO family originated from the Emperor Saga)
He also adopted MINAMOTO no Koreshige of Saga Genji (the MINAMOTO family originated from Emperor Saga).
He also adopted MINAMOTO no Koreshige of Saga Genji (the MINAMOTO clan originated from Emperor Saga).

tit.cmt: Biography→Brief Personal Historyに変更しました。

sen.j: 幼少より太皇太后橘嘉智子の寵愛を受ける。
sen.e: He was the Empress Dowager TACHIBANA no Kachiko's favorite since his childhood.
He had been the favorite of Empress Dowager TACHIBANA no Kachiko since his childhood.
He had been the favorite of Empress Dowager TACHIBANA no Kachiko since his childhood.

sen.j: 16歳で父・仁明天皇の御前にて元服して四品親王となり、以後中務卿・式部卿・相撲司（別当）・大宰帥・常陸国及び上野国太守と親王が歴任する官職をほぼ全てを歴任し、53歳のときに一品親王となって諸親王の筆頭となる。
sen.e: He had a coming-of -age-ceremony when he was sixteen in front of his father, Emperor NINMYO and became Shihon Shinno (Prince), after that he worked as Nakatsukasa kyo (a chief of the Nakatsukasa Ministry), Shikibu kyo (a chief of the Shikibu Ministry), Sumai no tsukasa (in charge of sumo matches held in the presence of the Emperor), Dazai no sotsu (director of Dazai Office), Taishu (a governor) of Hitachi Province and Kozuke Province, after filling almost all the officials as prince successively, finally he became Ippon Shinno(Prince), principal of Princes.
sen.cmt: 一品親王 定訳不明。一品は、親王の位階の第１位。
sen.e: He had a coming-of -age ceremony when he was 16 in front of his father, Emperor Ninmyo, and became Shihon Shinno (Prince), after which he worked as Nakatsukasa kyo (a chief of the Nakatsukasa Ministry), Shikibu kyo (a chief of the Shikibu Ministry), Sumai no tsukasa (in charge of the sumo matches held in the presence of the Emperor), Dazai no sotsu (director of the Dazai Office), Taishu (a governor) of Hitachi Province and Kozuke Province, after nearly all the official positions had been filled, and as prince successively, after which he became Ippon Shinno (Prince), the principal of princes.

He had a coming-of -age ceremony when he was 16 years old in front of his father, Emperor Nimmyo, and became Shihon Shinno (Prince), after which he worked as Nakatsukasa kyo (a chief of the Nakatsukasa Ministry), Shikibu kyo (a chief of the Shikibu Ministry), Sumai no tsukasa (in charge of the sumo matches held in the presence of the Emperor), Dazai no sotsu (director of the Dazai Office), Taishu (a governor) of Hitachi Province and Kozuke Province, after nearly all the official positions had been filled, after which he became Ippon Shinno (Prince), the principal of princes when he was 53 years old.

sen.j: 陽成天皇が藤原基経によって廃位されたのち55歳で即位。
sen.e: He enthroned when he was fifty five years old after Emperor YOZEI was overthrown by FUJIWARA no Mototsune.
He was enthroned when he was 55 years old, after Emperor Yozei was overthrown by FUJIWARA no Mototsune.
He was enthroned when he was 55 years old, after Emperor Yozei was overthrown by FUJIWARA no Mototsune.

sen.j: 『徒然草』には即位後も炊事を自分でしたとある。
sen.e: According to "Tsurezure gusa (Essays in Idleness), it is said the Emperor did his cook-genera after the enthronement.
According to "Tsurezure gusa (Essays in Idleness)," it is said that the Emperor did his own general cooking after the enthronement.
According to "Tsurezure gusa (Essays in Idleness)," it is said that the Emperor did his own general cooking after the enthronement.

sen.j: 藤原基経を関白にし政務を執らせた。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Mototsune was appointed as a chancellor and he dealt with the politics.
FUJIWARA no Mototsune was appointed as a chancellor, and he dealt with politics.
FUJIWARA no Mototsune was appointed as a chancellor, and he dealt with politics.

sen.j: 即位と同時に皇子を多く臣籍降下させたが、病を得たため仁和3年8月25日に子宇多天皇（さだみ）を親王に復し、翌8月26日に立太子させた。
sen.e: As soon as he was enthroned, he allowed many Princes demote from nobility to subject, due to his illness, his son, Emperor UDA (Sadami) was returned as a Prince on August 25th, Ninna 3 and Emperor UDA became Crown Prince on August 26th, Ninna 4.

As soon as he was enthroned, he allowed many princes to be demoted from nobles to subjects; due to his illness, his son, Emperor UDA (Sadami) was returned as a prince on August 25, Ninna 3 and Emperor Uda became crown prince on August 26, Ninna 4.

As soon as he was enthroned, he allowed many princes to be demoted from nobles to subjects; due to his illness, his son, Emperor Uda (Sadami) was returned as a prince on August 25, Ninna 3 and Emperor Uda became the crown prince on August 26, Ninna 4.

sen.j: 同日に崩御し、定省親王が宇多天皇として践祚した。
sen.e: The Emperor KOKO died on the same day and Prince Sadami ascended to the throne as Emperor UDA.
Emperor Koko died on the same day, and Prince Sadami ascended to the throne as Emperor Uda.
Emperor Koko died on the same day, and Prince Sadami ascended to the throne as Emperor Uda.

sen.j: 宮中行事の再興に務めるとともに諸芸に優れた文化人でもあったとされる。
sen.e: It is said he worked to restore court functions and he was very versatile, highly-educated.
It is said that he worked to restore court functions and that, as a highly educated person, he was very versatile.
It is said that he worked to restore court functions and that, as a highly educated person, he was very versatile.

sen.j: 和歌・和琴などに秀でともされ、桓武天皇の先例に倣って鷹狩を復活させた。
sen.e: He was good at making poems and playing thirteen-stringed koto, he brought back falconry by following precedent of Emperor KANMU.
He was good at making poems and playing the thirteen-string koto, and he brought back falconry by following the precedent of Emperor Kanmu.
He was good at making poems and playing the 13-string koto, and he brought back falconry by following the precedent of Emperor Kammu.

sen.j: また、親王時代に相撲司別当を務めていた関係か即位後相撲を奨励している。
sen.e: Also he encouraged Sumo, it is considered this was due to him working as Sumai no tsukasa when he was Prince. (in charge of sumo matches held in the presence of the Emperor)
He also encouraged Sumo, presumably because as a prince he had worked as the sumai no tsukasa (in charge of the sumo matches held in the presence of the Emperor).
He also encouraged Sumo, presumably because as a prince he had worked as the sumai no tsukasa (in charge of the sumo matches held in the presence of the Emperor).

sen.j: 晩年は政治改革と親王時代の住居であったとされる宇多院の近くに勅願寺創建を計画するも実現を見ぬままに終わり、後を継いだ宇多天皇の「寛平の治」及び仁和寺創建に継承されることになる。
sen.e: In his final years he aimed to do political reform and to build a temple (by the Imperial order) near Uda-in where he spent his time while he was Prince, however it did not come true, and was succeeded to next Emperor, Emperor UDA to rule ' The peaceful era of Kanpyo' and to build Ninna-ji Temple.

In his final years he aimed to undertake political reform and build a temple (by the Imperial order) near Uda-in, where he had spent his time during princehood; however, it did not come true, and it was succeeded to the next Emperor, Uda, to rule 'the peaceful era of Kanpyo' and build Ninna-ji Temple.

In his final years he aimed to undertake political reform and build a temple (by imperial order) near Uda-in, where he had spent his time during princehood; however, it didn't come true, and it was succeeded to the next Emperor, Uda, to rule 'the peaceful era of Kampyo' and build Ninna-ji Temple.

sen.j: 『日本三代実録』にある「天皇少（わか）くして聡明、好みて経史を読む。
sen.e: According to "Nihon sandai jitsuroku" it is said 'the young Emperor KOKO is intelligent and preferred to read Chinese classics on ethics, politics, and history books.'
According to "Nihon sandai jitsuroku," 'the young Emperor Koko was intelligent and preferred to read Chinese classics on ethics, politics and history books.'
According to "Nihon sandai jitsuroku," 'the young Emperor Koko was intelligent and preferred to read Chinese classics on ethics, politics and history books.'

sen.j: 容止閑雅、謙恭和潤、慈仁寛曠、九族を親愛す。
sen.e: His behavior was elegant, he was moderate and calm, had a greater latitude.
His behavior was elegant; he was moderate and calm, and had greater latitude.
His behavior was elegant; he was moderate and calm, and had greater latitude.

sen.j: 性、風流多く、尤も人事に長ず」と評されている。
sen.e: He was describe to be gracious and understands things Humanly.
He was described as gracious, having the ability to understand things in human terms.
He was described as gracious, having the ability to understand things in human terms.

sen.j: 830年（天長7年）、生誕
sen.e: Emperor KOKO was born in 830.
Emperor KOKO was born in 830.
830: Emperor Koko was born.
sen.cmt: KOKO→Koko"Emperor Koko was born in 830."→"830: Emperor Koko was born."に変更しました。

sen.j: 常陸太守、中務卿、上野太守など歴任
sen.e: He filled the position of Taishu (a governor) of Hitachi Province, Kozuke Province and Nakatsukasa kyo (a chief of the Nakatsukasa Ministry) successively.
He filled successive position as the taishu (governor) of Hitachi Province and Kozuke Province, and as the nakatsukasa kyo (a chief of the Nakatsukasa Ministry).
He filled successive position as the taishu (governor) of Hitachi Province and Kozuke Province, and as the nakatsukasa kyo (a chief of the Nakatsukasa Ministry).

sen.j: 876年（貞観18年）、式部卿
sen.e: He became Shikibu kyo (a chief of the Shikibu Ministry) in 876.
He became Shikibu kyo (a chief of the Shikibu Ministry) in 876.
876: He became Shikibu kyo (a chief of the Shikibu Ministry)
sen.cmt: "He became Shikibu kyo (a chief of the Shikibu Ministry) in 876."→"876: He became Shikibu kyo (a chief of the Shikibu Ministry)"に変更しました。

sen.j: 882年（元慶6年）、一品親王
sen.e: He became Ippon Shinno(Prince) in 882.
He became Ippon Shinno (prince) in 882.
882: He became Imperial Prince Ippon.
sen.cmt: "He became Ippon Shinno (prince) in 882."→"882: He became Imperial Prince Ippon.."に変更しました。

sen.j: 884年（元慶8年）、即位
sen.e: He enthroned in 884.
He was enthroned in 884.
884: He was enthroned.
sen.cmt: "He was enthroned in 884."→"884: He was enthroned."に変更しました。

sen.j: 887年（仁和3年）、崩御
sen.e: He died in 887.
He died in 887.
887: He died.
sen.cmt: "He died in 887."→"887: He died."に変更しました。

sen.j: 元慶
sen.e: Gangyo/Gankyo
Gangyo/Gankyo
Gangyo/Gankyo

sen.j: 仁和
sen.e: Ninna
Ninna
Ninna

sen.j: 御陵は、小松山陵（後田邑陵：のちのたむらのみささぎ）。
sen.e: Imperial mausoleum is Komatsu yama no misasagi. (Nochi no tamura no misasagi)
The imperial mausoleum is Komatsu yama no misasagi (Nochi no tamura no misasagi).
The imperial mausoleum is Komatsu yama no misasagi (Nochi no tamura no misasagi).

sen.j: 小倉百人一首にとられる。
sen.e: Following is the Emperor KOKO's poem from the Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets.
The following is Emperor Koko's poem from "A Hundred Poems by a Hundred Poets":
The following is Emperor Koko's poem from "A Hundred Poems by a Hundred Poets":

sen.j: 君がため 春の野に出でて 若菜つむ わが衣手に 雪はふりつつ（きみがため はるののにいでて わかなつむ わがころもでに ゆきはふりつつ）
sen.e: I went out to the field and pick up young greens for you, and the snow is falling on my sleeves.
sen.cmt: 括弧内は読みのため、あえて訳出等しておりません。ご了承ください。
sen.e: I went out to the field and picked up young greens for you, and the snow was falling on my sleeves.
I went out to the field and picked up young greens for you, and the snow was falling on my sleeves.
